meanings.definition: The quality or state of being literary.
meanings.sent1: Her writing displayed a strong literarinesses that captivated the readers.
meanings.sent2: The professor discussed the literarinesses of the classic novel during the lecture.
meanings.sent3: The literarinesses of the poem made the students appreciate the beauty of language.
meanings.sent4: The author's unique literarinesses painted vivid images in the minds of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The literarinesses of the short story left a lasting impact on the young writer.

meanings.definition: The characteristics or traits of literature.
meanings.sent1: The book club members analyzed the literarinesses of the latest bestseller.
meanings.sent2: She appreciated the literarinesses of the different genres of literature.
meanings.sent3: The literarinesses of the play added depth to the characters' dialogues.
meanings.sent4: His writing style reflected the literarinesses of the Romantic era.
meanings.sent5: The literarinesses of the poem resonated with the audience's emotions.
